Protocol.name: OrionPublic

Enum.name: OrionPktType_t
Enum.comment: enumerated identifiers for Orion public packets

Value.name: ORION_PKT_CMD
Value.comment: Basic commands for control of gimbal pan and tilt.

Value.name: ORION_PKT_RESET
Value.comment: Send this packet to cause the gimbal to reset

Value.name: ORION_PKT_LIMITS
Value.comment: Pan and tilt limits for current, acceleration, velocity, and position

Value.name: ORION_PKT_CLEVIS_VERSION
Value.comment: Software version for the clevis board

Value.name: ORION_PKT_CROWN_VERSION
Value.comment: Software version for the crown board

Value.name: ORION_PKT_PAYLOAD_VERSION
Value.comment: Software version for the payload board

Value.name: ORION_PKT_SOFTWARE_DIAGNOSTICS
Value.comment: Diagnostic information related to software performance for a processor

Value.name: ORION_PKT_CAMERA_SWITCH
Value.comment: Command the gimbal to swtich cameras

Value.name: ORION_PKT_CAMERA_STATE
Value.comment: Command a camera in the gimbal

Value.name: ORION_PKT_NETWORK_VIDEO
Value.comment: Command the IP settings for video delivery

Value.name: ORION_PKT_RETRACT_CMD
Value.comment: Retract or deploy command for a gimbal retraction mechanism

Value.name: ORION_PKT_DEBUG_STRING
Value.comment: A human readable text string which is typically used for debugging purposes

Value.name: ORION_PKT_USER_DATA
Value.comment: Packet for sending user data to a serial port in the gimbal

Value.name: ORION_PKT_GPS_DATA
Value.comment: Raw GPS data input or output

Value.name: ORION_PKT_INS_QUALITY
Value.comment: Quality of the inertial navigation system

Value.name: ORION_PKT_GEOLOCATE_TELEMETRY
Value.comment: Information needed to locate the gimbal and its imagery

Value.name: ORION_PKT_GEOPOINT_CMD
Value.comment: Command the gimbal to go to Geopoint mode

Value.name: ORION_PKT_RANGE_DATA
Value.comment: Range information from the gimbal to its target

Value.name: ORION_PKT_PATH
Value.comment: Command the gimbal to path track mode

Value.name: ORION_PKT_INS_OPTIONS
Value.comment: Configuration options for the Inertial Navigation System

Value.name: ORION_PKT_STARE_START
Value.comment: Stare portion of step stare started

Value.name: ORION_PKT_NETWORK_SETTINGS
Value.comment: Change the IP network settings in the gimbal

Enum.name: GimbalAxis_t
Enum.comment: Enumeration of gimbal pan and tilt axes

Value.name: NUM_GIMBAL_AXES
Value.comment: Total number of axis in the gimbal

Enum.name: BodyAxis_t
Enum.comment: Enumeration for body axis X, Y, Z arrays

Value.name: AXIS_Y
Value.comment: Y points to the right (if X is forward)

Enum.name: OrionBoardEnumeration_t
Enum.comment: Enumeration identifying different boards in the Orion Gimbal

Enum.name: OrionMode_t
Enum.comment: The mode of operation of the gimbal.

Value.name: ORION_MODE_RATE
Value.comment: Commands give the line of sight angular rate of the camera

Value.name: ORION_MODE_FFC
Value.comment: Commands the gimbal to perform a flat field correction, pan and tilt will drive the IR camera to look at the black body

Value.name: ORION_MODE_SCENE
Value.comment: Commands give the angular rate of the image produced by the camera

Value.name: ORION_MODE_TRACK
Value.comment: Commands give the angular rate of the track box in the camera image

Value.name: ORION_MODE_CALIBRATION
Value.comment: Drives the pan and tilt axes to calibrate the stabilizer gyros

Value.name: ORION_MODE_POSITION
Value.comment: Commands give the position of the pan and tilt axes with respect to the gimbal mount

Value.name: ORION_MODE_GEOPOINT
Value.comment: Gimbal is pointing toward a fixed spatial location

Value.name: ORION_MODE_PATH
Value.comment: Gimbal is pointing toward a fixed path in space, and may be doing step-stare

Value.name: ORION_MODE_DOWN
Value.comment: Gimbal is pointing straight down, and may be doing step-stare

Value.name: ORION_MODE_UNKNOWN
Value.comment: Unknown gimbal mode. This is unused in normal operation and is strictly to maintain compatibility with v1.2

Data.name: year
Data.comment: Years after 2000

Data.name: month
Data.comment: Month of the year, from 1 to 12

Data.name: day
Data.comment: Day of the month, from 1 to 31

Packet.name: OrionCmd
Packet.comment: Basic commands for control of gimbal pan and tilt.

Data.name: Target
Data.comment: pan and tilt commands in radians or radians per second. Interpretation depends on Mode

Data.name: Mode
Data.comment: operational mode of the gimbal. Note that not all modes can be directly commanded. Path and Geopoint models specifically need to be commanded through their respective packets.

Data.name: Stabilized
Data.comment: non-zero to enable inertial stabilization. If zero then commands are with respect to gimbal mount, otherwise Target is with respect to inertial or image space.

Data.name: ImpulseTime
Data.comment: amount of time in seconds for changing the gimbal position

Packet.name: OrionLaserCommand
Packet.comment: Command to fire the laser (if installed).

Data.name: Reserved
Data.comment: Deprecated parameter - set to zero

Data.name: Index
Data.comment: Index of the laser to apply this command to

Data.name: Password
Data.comment: Password, if required by the laser. If a password is required, it must be provided in order to change any aspect of the laser's state (e.g., enable/disable, arm/disarm, fire/deactivate

Data.name: Enable
Data.comment: Set to zero to disable the laser, or non-zero to enable it

Data.name: Arm
Data.comment: Set to zero to disarm the laser, or non-zero to arm

Data.name: Fire
Data.comment: Set to zero to deactivate the laser, or non-zero to activate it

Data.name: OnTime
Data.comment: Periodic laser pulse on time, in milliseconds, or zero to fire continuously

Data.name: OffTime
Data.comment: Periodic laser pulse off time, in milliseconds, or zero to fire continuously

Data.name: PrfCode
Data.comment: Laser PRF code, if applicable

Enum.name: OrionMaxLasers_t
Enum.comment: The maximum number of lasers in an Orion Gimbal

Data.name: Type
Data.comment: The type of this laser

Data.name: Enabled
Data.comment: Set to 1 if the laser is enabled, otherwise 0

Data.name: Armed
Data.comment: Set to 1 if the laser is armed, otherwise 0

Data.name: Active
Data.comment: Set to 1 if the laser is active, otherwise 0

Data.name: GroundSpeedLock
Data.comment: Set to 1 if the laser is locked due to low ground speed, otherwise 0

Data.name: AltitudeLock
Data.comment: Set to 1 if the laser is locked due to low GPS altitude, otherwise 0

Data.name: PasswordLock
Data.comment: Set to 1 if the laser is locked by password, otherwise 0

Data.name: Reserved
Data.comment: Reserved for future use

Data.name: WaitTimer
Data.comment: Time remaining, in milliseconds, before the laser will accept another command

Data.name: NumLasers
Data.comment: Number of installed lasers

Packet.name: OrionLimitsData
Packet.comment: and tilt limits of operation.

Data.name: MinPos
Data.comment: Minimum position in radians

Data.name: MaxPos
Data.comment: Maximum position in radians

Data.name: MaxVel
Data.comment: Maximum velocity in radians per second

Data.name: MaxAccel
Data.comment: Maximum acceleration in radians per second per second

Data.name: ContCur
Data.comment: Maximum continuous current in Amps

Data.name: PeakCur
Data.comment: Maximum peak current in Amps

Data.name: PeakCurTime
Data.comment: Peak current time in seconds

Data.name: InitCur
Data.comment: Initialization current in Amps

Data.name: MaxPower
Data.comment: Maximum motor output power, in watts. Set to zero for no limit

Packet.name: OrionClevisVersion
Packet.comment: Software version for the clevis board in the Orion gimbal. Send this packet with zero length to request the version information.

Data.name: Version
Data.comment: Version of the clevis board software

Data.name: PartNumber
Data.comment: Hardware details of the clevis board

Packet.name: OrionCrownVersion
Packet.comment: Software version for the crown board in the Orion Gimbal

Data.name: Version
Data.comment: Version of the crown board software

Data.name: PartNumber
Data.comment: Hardware details of the crown board

Packet.name: OrionPayloadVersion
Packet.comment: Software version for the payload board in the Orion Gimbal

Data.name: Version
Data.comment: Version of the payload board software

Data.name: PartNumber
Data.comment: Hardware details of the payload board

Packet.name: OrionResetSource
Packet.comment: Reset information for a processor in the Orion Gimbal. This packet is transmitted by each processor in the gimbal following its bootup

Data.name: Vector
Data.comment: Interrupt vector for the last reset

Data.name: Address
Data.comment: Program counter prior to the reset (not yet used)

Data.name: sourceBoard
Data.comment: Enumeration defining which board in the gimbal generated this message

Packet.name: OrionBoard
Packet.comment: Information for a specific board in the gimbal. Send this packet with zero length to request the board information.

Data.name: boardSN
Data.comment: Serial number of this board

Data.name: assemblySN
Data.comment: Serial number of the whole assembly

Data.name: config
Data.comment: Configuration bits

Data.name: reserved
Data.comment: Reserved space for future things

Data.name: boardEnum
Data.comment: Enumeration defining which board in the gimbal this data applies to

Data.name: manufactureDate
Data.comment: Date the board was manufactured

Data.name: calibrationDate
Data.comment: Date the board was calibrated

Packet.name: OrionDiagnostics
Packet.comment: Electrical diagnostic data for the Orion gimbal. This packet is sent by the gimbal every 3 seconds.

Data.name: Voltage24
Data.comment: Voltage of the 24-volt rail

Data.name: Voltage12
Data.comment: Voltage of the 12-volt rail

Data.name: Voltage3v3
Data.comment: Voltage of the 3.3-volt rail

Data.name: Current24
Data.comment: Current in Amps of the 24-volt rail

Data.name: Current12
Data.comment: Current in Amps of the 12-volt rail

Data.name: Current3v3
Data.comment: Current in Amps of the 3.3-volt rail

Data.name: CrownTemp
Data.comment: Temperature of the crown board in degrees Celsius

Data.name: SlaTemp
Data.comment: Temperature of the SLA-1500 board (if applicable) in degrees Celsius

Data.name: GyroTemp
Data.comment: Stabilization gyro ADC temperature in degrees Celsius

Data.name: reserved
Data.comment: Reserved space for future expansion

Data.name: Voltage24Var
Data.comment: Voltage variance of the 24-volt rail

Data.name: Voltage12Var
Data.comment: Voltage variance of the 12-volt rail

Data.name: Voltage3v3Var
Data.comment: Voltage variance of the 3.3-volt rail

Data.name: Current24Var
Data.comment: Current variance in Amps of the 24-volt rail

Data.name: Current12Var
Data.comment: Current variance in Amps of the 12-volt rail

Data.name: Current3v3Var
Data.comment: Current variance in Amps of the 3.3-volt rail

Packet.name: OrionPerformance
Packet.comment: Measurements related to stabilization performance. This packet is sent by the gimbal 4 times per second.

Data.name: RmsQuad
Data.comment: Quad rms errors

Data.name: RmsDir
Data.comment: Dir rms errors

Data.name: RmsVel
Data.comment: Vel rms errors

Data.name: RmsPos
Data.comment: Pos rms errors

Data.name: Iout
Data.comment: Output current

Packet.name: OrionSoftwareDiagnostics
Packet.comment: Diagnostic information related to software performance for a specific board in the Orion Gimbal. This packet is sent by the gimbal once per second.

Data.name: sourceBoard
Data.comment: Enumeration defining which board in the gimbal generated this message

Data.name: numCores
Data.comment: Number of CPU cores that this packet reports for

Data.name: reserved
Data.comment: Reserved space for future expansion

Data.name: cpuLoad
Data.comment: CPU utilization as a percentage

Data.name: heapLoad
Data.comment: Heap memory utilization as a percentage, 0 if no heap is present

Data.name: stackLoad
Data.comment: System stack memory utilization as a percentage, 0 if no system stack is present

Data.name: reserved
Data.comment: Reserved space for future expansion

Data.name: numThreads
Data.comment: Number of threads in the system, must be at least 1

Structure.name: ThreadLoading
Structure.comment: Per-thread information, in order of priority (highest to lowest)

Data.name: cpuLoad
Data.comment: CPU utilization of this thread as a percentage

Data.name: heapLoad
Data.comment: Heap memory utilization of this thread as a percentage, 0 if no heap is present

Data.name: stackLoad
Data.comment: Stack memory utilization of this thread as a percentage, 100 if stack overflow occurs

Data.name: watchdogLeft
Data.comment: Worst case amount of watchdog time remaining in this reporting period for this thread, 0 if watchdog has timed out

Data.name: reserved
Data.comment: Reserved space for future expansion

Packet.name: OrionVibration
Packet.comment: Platform vibration amplitude and frequency information. This packet is sent by the gimbal once every five seconds.

Data.name: MaxAccel
Data.comment: Maximum acceleration values, in m/s/s

Data.name: MaxGyro
Data.comment: Maximum angular rate values, in rad/s

Structure.name: FftData
Structure.comment: A series of points containing FFT-derived frequency and magnitude data

Data.name: Frequency
Data.comment: Frequency, in Hertz, of the data point defined by this element

Data.name: Accel
Data.comment: Acceleration magnitude, expressed as a percentage of MaxAccel

Data.name: Gyro
Data.comment: Angular rate magnitude, expressed as a percentage of MaxGyro

Packet.name: OrionCameraSwitch
Packet.comment: Command the gimbal to swtich cameras

Data.name: Index
Data.comment: The index of the camera to switch to

Packet.name: OrionCameraState
Packet.comment: Command a camera in the gimbal. Note this packet will eventually be deprecated

Data.name: Zoom
Data.comment: Digital zoom ratio

Data.name: Focus
Data.comment: Focus command/position

Data.name: Index
Data.comment: The index of the camera to command

Packet.name: OrionNetworkVideo
Packet.comment: Command the IP settings for video delivery

Data.name: DestIp
Data.comment: destination IPv4 address

Data.name: Port
Data.comment: desitnation port

Data.name: Bitrate
Data.comment: Video encoding target bitrate, in bits per second

Data.name: Ttl
Data.comment: TTL value for UDP video packets. Values less than or equal to zero will use default values of 64 for unicast and 1 for multicast.

Packet.name: OrionFlirSettings
Packet.comment: FLIR-specific camera settings

Data.name: Index
Data.comment: Index of the camera that these settings should apply to. Use 0xFF to apply to any connected FLIR camera.

Data.name: BlackHot
Data.comment: Image polarity setting - set to 0 for white hot or 1 for black hot

Data.name: MaxAgcGain
Data.comment: Maximum AGC output gain

Data.name: AceLevel
Data.comment: Active Contrast Enhancement (ACE) level

Data.name: DdeThreshold
Data.comment: DDE spatial threshold

Data.name: AgcMidpoint
Data.comment: AGC output midpoint, from 0 to 255

Packet.name: OrionAptinaSettings
Packet.comment: Aptina-specific camera settings

Data.name: Index
Data.comment: Index of the camera that these settings should apply to. Use 0xFF to apply to any connected Aptina camera.

Data.name: MinExposure
Data.comment: Minimum exposure time in microseconds

Data.name: MaxExposure
Data.comment: Maximum exposure time in milliseconds

Data.name: MinGain
Data.comment: Minimum sensor luminance gain

Data.name: MaxGain
Data.comment: Maximum sensor luminance gain

Data.name: Brightness
Data.comment: Brightness adjustment

Data.name: Contrast
Data.comment: Contrast adjustment

Data.name: Saturation
Data.comment: Saturation adjustment

Data.name: Sharpness
Data.comment: Sharpening filter strength

Packet.name: OrionZafiroSettings
Packet.comment: Zafiro-specific camera settings

Data.name: Index
Data.comment: Index of the camera that these settings should apply to. Use 0xFF to apply to any connected Zafiro camera.

Data.name: BlackHot
Data.comment: Image polarity setting - set to 0 for white hot or 1 for black hot

Data.name: IntegrationTime
Data.comment: Integration time, in milliseconds

Data.name: LapEnabled
Data.comment: Local Area Processing (LAP) enable/disable flag. Set to zero to disable, or non-zero to enable.

Data.name: LapGain
Data.comment: LAP Sharpening gain

Data.name: AgcSaturation
Data.comment: AGC histogram saturation

Packet.name: OrionHitachiSettings
Packet.comment: Hitachi-specific camera settings

Data.name: Index
Data.comment: Index of the camera that these settings should apply to. Use 0xFF to apply to any connected Hitachi camera.

Data.name: IntegrationTime
Data.comment: Integration time in microseconds, or negative to disable shutter-priority mode

Data.name: Aperture
Data.comment: Aperture f-number, or negative to disable aperture-priority mode

Packet.name: OrionAutopilotData
Packet.comment: Autopilot state data

Data.name: IsFlying
Data.comment: Set to 1 if flying, otherwise 0

Data.name: CommGood
Data.comment: Set to 1 if AP comms are good, otherwise 0

Data.name: Agl
Data.comment: Altitude above ground level in meters. Invalid if less than zero

Value.name: RETRACT_CMD_DEPLOY
Value.comment: Move the gimbal to a deployed position

Value.name: RETRACT_CMD_RETRACT
Value.comment: Move the gimbal to a retracted position

Packet.name: OrionRetractCommand
Packet.comment: Retract or deploy command for a gimbal retraction mechanism

Data.name: Cmd
Data.comment: The retraction mechanism command

Data.name: Reserved
Data.comment: Reserved for future use

Packet.name: OrionRetractStatus
Packet.comment: Current gimbal retraction mechanism status. This is sent by the gimbal regularly only if a retract system is installed.

Value.name: RETRACT_STATE_RETRACTING
Value.comment: Retract is moving to the retracted position

Value.name: RETRACT_STATE_DEPLOYING
Value.comment: Retract is moving to the deployed position

Value.name: RETRACT_STATE_FAULT
Value.comment: Retract is experiencing a fault condition

Data.name: Cmd
Data.comment: The current command being tracked by the retract mechanism

Data.name: State
Data.comment: The retraction mechanism state

Data.name: Pos
Data.comment: Current retract position in radians

Data.name: Flags
Data.comment: GPIO status information flags

Packet.name: DebugString
Packet.comment: This packet sends a human readable text string which is typically used for debugging purposes

Enum.name: debugSource
Enum.comment: The source of a debug packet.

Value.name: sourceCrown
Value.comment: The debug packet came from the crown board software

Value.name: sourceClevis
Value.comment: The debug packet came from the clevis board software

Value.name: sourcePayload
Value.comment: The debug packet came from the payload board software

Data.name: source
Data.comment: Identifier to determine which board sent the debug packet

Data.name: priority
Data.comment: The importance of the debug message (to be defined)

Data.name: description
Data.comment: human readable description of the debug problem

Packet.name: OrionUserData
Packet.comment: This packet can be used to transfer user-defined data payloads between communication ports on the gimbal

Data.name: port
Data.comment: Destination INS board communication port identifier

Data.name: size
Data.comment: User data array size in bytes

Data.name: id
Data.comment: User-defined unique identifier or sequence number for this data block

Data.name: data
Data.comment: User data byte array

Packet.name: OrionExtHeadingData
Packet.comment: Externally supplied heading information. Send this packet to supply a correction to the heading of the inertial navigation system of the gimbal. This packet will be echoed back to the user if INS logging is enabled.

Data.name: extHeading
Data.comment: External true heading observation in radians from -pi to pi

Data.name: noise
Data.comment: Sensor noise of the heading observation in radians. Send 0 to cause the INS to simply shift its heading. Otherwise the extHeading will be fed into the INS kalman filter with this sensor noise.

Data.name: headingInGimbalAxis
Data.comment: Set this if the provided heading is in gimbal native axis rather than the platform axis. This will cause the gimbal to rotate the heading reference as needed to the platform axis used by the INS. This will have no effect if the INS options do not specify a platform rotation

Packet.name: GpsData
Packet.comment: Raw GPS data for analysis. This packet arrives with each report, or once per second, whichever is faster. Unless the gimbal is in INS debug mode, in which case this packet is sent for every GPS report. Note that not all data in the structure are inclued in the packet. Everything after verticalVelocityValid is not sent in the packet, but can instead be constructed from the preceding data

Enum.name: gpsSource_t
Enum.comment: Enumeration for source of GPS data

Value.name: nmeaSource
Value.comment: External GPS, supplied by NMEA input

Enum.name: ubloxFixType_t
Enum.comment: Enumeration for types of GPS solutions, derived from uBlox specification

Value.name: timeOnly
Value.comment: Time only, no position or velocity

Data.name: FixType
Data.comment: uBlox fix type

Data.name: FixState
Data.comment: uBlox fix state

Data.name: TrackedSats
Data.comment: The number of satellites used in the GPS solution

Data.name: PDOP
Data.comment: Position dilution of precision

Data.name: Latitude
Data.comment: Geodetic latitude in radians, positive North

Data.name: Longitude
Data.comment: Longitude in radians, positive East

Data.name: Altitude
Data.comment: Altitude in meters above the WGS-84 ellipsoid

Data.name: VelNED
Data.comment: Velocity in North, East, Down meters per second

Data.name: Hacc
Data.comment: Horizontal accuracy in meters

Data.name: Vacc
Data.comment: Vertical accuracy in meters

Data.name: SpeedAcc
Data.comment: Speed accuracy in meters per second

Data.name: HeadingAcc
Data.comment: Course accuracy in radians

Data.name: ITOW
Data.comment: GPS time of week in milliseconds

Data.name: Week
Data.comment: GPS week number since Jan 6 1980

Data.name: GeoidUndulation
Data.comment: Height of the mean seal level geoid with respect to the WGS-84 ellipsoid, in meters

Data.name: source
Data.comment: The source of the GPS data

Data.name: verticalVelocityValid
Data.comment: 0 if vertical velocity data are not valid

Data.name: Year
Data.comment: Year of the date

Data.name: Month
Data.comment: Month of the year from 1 to 12

Data.name: Day
Data.comment: Day of the month from 1 to 31

Data.name: Hour
Data.comment: Hour of the day from 0 to 23

Data.name: Minute
Data.comment: Minute of the hour from 0 to 59

Data.name: Second
Data.comment: Second of the minute from 0 to 59

Data.name: TimeValid
Data.comment: Nonzero if time information is valid

Data.name: GroundSpeed
Data.comment: Ground speed in meters per second

Data.name: GroundHeading
Data.comment: Course over ground in radians

Data.name: valid3DFix
Data.comment: Nonzero if position solution is valid and 3D

Packet.name: InsQuality
Packet.comment: This packet is transmitted regularly by the gimbal to communicate the quality of the inertial navigation system (INS) data. The INS is responsible for fusing the crown board IMU and GPS to determine the position, velocity, attitude, and IMU errors. The quality of the INS data directly impacts the quality of the data in the GEOLOCATE_TELEMETRY packet. This data are sent separately from that packet as the quality data changes much more slowly.

Enum.name: insMode_t
Enum.comment: Enumeration for the inertial navigation operational mode

Data.name: systemTime
Data.comment: Milliseconds since system bootup

Data.name: gpsSource
Data.comment: The source of GPS data

Data.name: reserved
Data.comment: Reserved packet space

Data.name: insMode
Data.comment: The operational mode of the INS

Data.name: hasGyroBias
Data.comment: 1 if the INS is computing and reporting gyro bias states

Data.name: hasGravityBias
Data.comment: 1 if the INS is computing and reporting a gravity bias state

Data.name: hasAccelBias
Data.comment: 1 if the INS is computing and reporting accelerometer bias states

Data.name: reservedbits
Data.comment: Reserved bits in the bitfield

Data.name: posRejected
Data.comment: 1 if the INS rejected the last position update because the chi-square value was too large.

Data.name: velRejected
Data.comment: 1 if the INS rejected the last velocity update because the chi-square value was too large.

Data.name: hdgRejected
Data.comment: 1 if the INS rejected the last heading update because the chi-square value was too large.

Data.name: gpsPeriod
Data.comment: Time in seconds between GPS measurements, 0 if no measurement

Data.name: hdgPeriod
Data.comment: Time in seconds between heading measurements, 0 if no measurement

Data.name: posChiSquare
Data.comment: Chi-square statistic of the last position observation

Data.name: velChiSquare
Data.comment: Chi-square statistic of the last velocity observation

Data.name: hdgChiSquare
Data.comment: Chi-square statistic of the last heading observation

Data.name: attConfidence
Data.comment: Attitude confidence in radians as a body Roll, Pitch, Yaw vector

Data.name: velConfidence
Data.comment: Velocity confidence in meters per second as a North, East, Down vector

Data.name: posConfidence
Data.comment: Position confidence in meters as a North, East, Down vector

Data.name: gyroConfidence
Data.comment: Rate gyro bias confidence in radians per second as a body Roll, Pitch, Yaw vector

Data.name: accelConfidence
Data.comment: Accelerometer bias confidence in m/s/s as a body X, Y, Z vector

Data.name: gravityConfidence
Data.comment: Gravity bias confidence in m/s/s

Data.name: gyroBias
Data.comment: Rate gyro bias estimate in radians per second as a body Roll, Pitch, Yaw vector

Data.name: accelBias
Data.comment: Accelerometer bias estimate in m/s/s as a body X, Y, Z vector

Data.name: gravityBias
Data.comment: Gravity bias estimate in m/s/s

Packet.name: GeolocateTelemetryCore
Packet.comment: This packet is transmitted regularly by the gimbal to communicate the information needed to locate the gimbal and its imagery. This includes gimbal position, velocity, attitude, camera angles and fields of view.

Data.name: systemTime
Data.comment: Milliseconds since system bootup

Data.name: gpsITOW
Data.comment: GPS time of week in milliseconds

Data.name: gpsWeek
Data.comment: GPS week number since Jan 6 1980

Data.name: geoidUndulation
Data.comment: Height of the geoid with respect to the WGS84 ellipsoid, in meters

Data.name: posLat
Data.comment: Geodetic latitude of the gimbal in radians, positive North

Data.name: posLon
Data.comment: Longitude of the gimbal in radians, positive East

Data.name: posAlt
Data.comment: Altitude of the gimbal in meters above the WGS-84 ellipsoid

Data.name: velNED
Data.comment: Velocity of the gimbal in North, East, Down meters per second

Data.name: gimbalQuat
Data.comment: Gimbal quaternion describing the rotation from the gimbal mount frame to the North, East, Down navigation frame

Data.name: pan
Data.comment: Gimbal pan angle in radians from -pi to pi

Data.name: tilt
Data.comment: Gimbal tilt angle in radians from -pi to pi

Data.name: hfov
Data.comment: Horizontal field of view of the camera in radians from 0 to 2pi

Data.name: vfov
Data.comment: Vertical field of view of the camera in radians from 0 to 2pi

Data.name: losECEF
Data.comment: Vector from the gimbal to the image location in ECEF meters. The image location is only computed if ranging data are provided to the gimbal. Otherwise the image location data are 0,0,0

Data.name: pixelWidth
Data.comment: Active focal plane width in pixels

Data.name: pixelHeight
Data.comment: Active focal plane height in pixels

Data.name: mode
Data.comment: Operational mode of the gimbal.

Data.name: pathProgress
Data.comment: Distance along the path from 0 (the starting point) to 1 (the ending point). This only applies if the mode is ORION_MODE_PATH.

Data.name: stareTime
Data.comment: Seconds remaining in the stare portion of a step stare point, 0 if stare is not in progress. This only applies if the mode is ORION_MODE_PATH.

Data.name: pathFrom
Data.comment: Index of the path point gimbal is traveling from. This only applies if the mode is ORION_MODE_PATH.

Data.name: pathTo
Data.comment: Index of the path point gimbal is traveling to. This only applies if the mode is ORION_MODE_PATH.

Data.name: imageShifts
Data.comment: X (horizontal) and Y (vertical) instantaneous image shifts in radians

Data.name: imageShiftDeltaTime
Data.comment: The amount of time in seconds over which these shifts apply. If no new shift data has arrived since this packet was last transmitted then the

Data.name: imageShiftConfidence
Data.comment: Registration solution confidence, from 0 (no confidence) to 1 (full confidence).

Data.name: outputShifts
Data.comment: X (horizontal) and Y (vertical) image shifts in radians, as displayed in the video stream

Packet.name: GeopointCmd
Packet.comment: Send this packet to command the gimbal to go to Geopoint mode. In this mode the looks at a target as given by a latitude, longitude, altitude position. The geopoint command can include a target velocity, which the gimbal will cause the gimbal to smoothly move its stare point as it propagates the target position. Geopoint mode is cancled by sending a normal OrionCmd packet.

Data.name: targetLat
Data.comment: Geodetic latitude of the target in radians, positive North

Data.name: targetLon
Data.comment: Longitude of the target in radians, positive East

Data.name: targetAlt
Data.comment: Altitude of the target in meters above the WGS-84 ellipsoid

Data.name: targetVelNED
Data.comment: Velocity of the target in North, East, Down meters per second

Packet.name: OrionRangeData
Packet.comment: Ranging information from the gimbal to its target. The gimbal will use this information to compute the target location and populate that informtaion in its telemetry output.

Value.name: RANGE_SRC_SKYLINK
Value.comment: Range information from skylink terrrain lookup

Data.name: range
Data.comment: Range to target in meters

Data.name: maxAgeMs
Data.comment: Maximum data age before expiration in milliseconds

Data.name: source
Data.comment: Source of range information

Packet.name: OrionPath
Packet.comment: The path packet contains a series of waypoints that define a path in 3D space. Sending this packet enables the path track logic, which will cause the gimbal to look at the nearest point on the path; or look directly downward. Path mode is canceled by sending a normal OrionCmd packet.

Enum.name: maxPathPoints
Enum.comment: Maximum number of points in a path.

Value.name: MAX_PATH_POINTS
Value.comment: Maximum number of points in a path

Data.name: numPoints
Data.comment: Number of points in the path

Data.name: pointDown
Data.comment: If numPoints is zero, and this is set, then the gimbal will point downwards

Data.name: reserved
Data.comment: Reserved for future expansion

Data.name: numCrossTrackSteps
Data.comment: Number of steps for across track stepping. Must be more than 1 to enable cross track stepping.

Data.name: posEcef
Data.comment: ECEF position in meters

Data.name: alongTrackStepAngle
Data.comment: Angle in radians for step-stare functionality along track. Set to zero for no step-stare. If doing downward pointing the gimbal must be receiving ORION_PKT_RANGE_DATA.

Data.name: crossTrackStepRatio
Data.comment: Ratio of cross track step angle to along track step angle. Set to zero for no cross track stepping.

Packet.name: InsOptions
Packet.comment: INS options give configuration options for the INS system on the Orion crown. Send this packet with zero length to request the options. Changing the INS options will cause the INS to be restarted if the platform rotation changes. When using platform rotation note the order: First yaw about the gimbal's z-axis to create an intermediate axis. Then pitch about the intermediate y-axis to create a second intermediate axis. Finally roll about the second intermediate x-axis to reach the platform orientation.

Data.name: enablePlatformRotation
Data.comment: The INS will be run in the platform reference frame if this is set. The platform reference frame is defined by the rotation from the gimbal reference frame to the platform frame. Set this if the gimbal is installed such that the gimbal reference frame is often near pitch of +/- 90 degrees.

Data.name: enableCourseIsHeading
Data.comment: If set then the INS will use the course of the GPS as a heading input for initialization and heading updates when the heading confidence is poor. This is appropriate for fixed wing aircraft if enablePlatformRotation is set.

Data.name: disableMagnetometer
Data.comment: If set then the INS will ignore any magnetometer measurements.

Data.name: disableGPS
Data.comment: If set then the INS will ignore any GPS measurements.

Data.name: resetINS
Data.comment: If set then the INS will be reset, all other fields of this packet are ignored in that case.

Data.name: reserved
Data.comment: reserved space for future expansion

Data.name: gimbalToPlatformEuler
Data.comment: Roll, Pitch, Yaw angles in radians from -pi to pi. The angles give the Euler rotation (yaw first, then pitch, then roll) that rotates a vector in the gimbal reference frame into the platform reference frame

Data.name: initialHeading
Data.comment: Initial heading angle in radians for the INS

Data.name: gpsLeverArm
Data.comment: X, Y, Z meters from GPS antenna to IMU in the gimbal reference frame, or the platform reference frame if enablePlatformRotation is on

Packet.name: StareStart
Packet.comment: Stare portion of step stare started. This packet is transmitted by the gimbal during step-stare operations to indicate that it is safe to acquire a step-stare image. The position data mark the desired location that the gimbal is trying to stare at.

Data.name: systemTime
Data.comment: Milliseconds since system bootup. This value should be echoed in the ORION_PKT_STARE_ACK respone.

Data.name: maxStareTime
Data.comment: Seconds remaining before the stare is finished. Send ORION_PKT_STARE_ACK to terminate the stare early.

Data.name: alongTrackStare
Data.comment: If set then this is the start of an along track stare, not a cross track track stare

Data.name: prevStareTerminatedByTime
Data.comment: If aset then the previous stare operation was terminated by timeout rather than an ORION_PKT_STARE_ACK packet

Data.name: prevStareTime
Data.comment: Seconds of time elapsed between the previous stare start and stare end. If this number approaches stareTime the image-acquisition system is in danger of not keeping up.

Data.name: stareLoad
Data.comment: Amount of time spent stepping and staring, as a ratio to the time between stare starts. As the frequency of stare events goes up this number will go towards 1.0, indicating the system has reached maximum utilization.

Data.name: posLat
Data.comment: Geodetic latitude of the stare point in radians, positive North

Data.name: posLon
Data.comment: Longitude of the stare point in radians, positive East

Data.name: posAlt
Data.comment: Altitude of the stare point in meters above the WGS-84 ellipsoid

Packet.name: StareAck
Packet.comment: This packet tells the gimbal that the step-stare image has been acquired and the gimbal can move to the next step stare point

Data.name: echoSystemTime
Data.comment: Milliseconds since system bootup received from ORION_PKT_STARE_START. If this value matches the value sent in ORION_PKT_STARE_START then the gimbal will terminate the stare operation early.

Packet.name: OrionNetworkSettings
Packet.comment: Change the IP network settings in the gimbal

Data.name: Ip
Data.comment: IPv4 address

Data.name: Mask
Data.comment: IPv4 network mask

Data.name: Gateway
Data.comment: IPv4 gateway address

Data.name: LowDelay
Data.comment: Set to 1 to use low-delay TCP mode (i.e. disable Nagle's Algorithm).
